thread.title: Big time recruit calms Terrapin devotees' fears
thread.title_full: Big time recruit calms Terrapin devotees' fears

title: Big time recruit calms Terrapin devotees' fears
text:
Facebook Email Twitter Google+ LinkedIn Pinterest Big time recruit calms Terrapin devotees' fears Pro-style QB Dwayne Haskins, committed to a college playing career at Maryland, confirms that he'll stay a Terp. Post to Facebook Big time recruit calms Terrapin devotees' fears Pro-style QB Dwayne Haskins, committed to a college playing career at Maryland, confirms that he'll stay a Terp.  //on.wusa9.com/1RwVv9A   Join the Conversation To   Big time recruit calms Terrapin devotees' fears Grace Olson, WUSA9 9:49 p.m. EDT October 8, 2015 Bullis quarterback Dwayne Haskins surveys the field for an open target. (Photo: The Bullis School) CONNECT 2 TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
The Maryland football program has spent the week preparing for a tough matchup against Big Ten conference opponent Ohio State. After a tougher start to the season than many predicted, the Terps are mustering everything they've got to take on the top-ranked team in the nation in the Buckeyes. 
Meanwhile, their next 'big thing' at the Bullis School nearby has been practicing to take on Riverdale High this Friday. Today, the highest-ranked quarterback Maryland has successfully recruited, Bullis senior Dwayne Haskins, has also been forced to answer questions on social media outlets regarding his commitment status to the program... 
As rumors began swirling regarding the status of the Terrapin coaching staff as the team enters Week 6 at only 2-3 on the season, those in the college football circles began questioning whether or not the 4-star quarterback recruit still wants to head to the College Park campus next year. But Haskins, who's said he's been 110% committed since he made his final decision, still says with complete confidence that he's a Terp. His focus right now? Staying plugged in at school and staying an active and engaged teammate at practice. Haskins reaffirmed his loyalty to the Terrapins today on Twitter. Blessed to have this opportunity. I'm verbally committed to University of Maryland. #GoTerps The Movement is REAL üê¢ pic.twitter.com/B5M6HyGrSy ‚Äî Dwayne Haskins, Jr‚ôö‚Ñ¢ (@dh_simba7) May 15, 2015 
Below, the 6'3", 204-lb. signal-caller shares the reasoning behind his original commitment to the one of the Big Ten's newest additions, as well as the subtle ways he's helping to build the program. WUSA9 reporter Grace Olson spoke with one of the country's top '16 recruits in Bullis quarterback Dwayne Haskins after he reaffirmed his commitment to the Terps.
